config.section.toggles-tooltip: Main Section for main system toggling
config.toggles.enablewindow-tooltip: If enabled, windows will play an open/close animation when you interact with them.
config.toggles.greenhousepanes-tooltip: Choose between which Greenhouse Panes to show
config.toggles.enableweather-tooltip: If enabled, all weather particles will be shown, otherwise none will. To stop showing a specific particle set the density to 0 in the Advanced Options.
config.toggles.enableGHweather-tooltip: If enabled, apply weather effects in the Greenhouse. Turn this OFF for compatibility with other Greenhouse retexture mods if having issues.
config.toggles.enableGHBG-tooltip: If enabled, displays the custom Greenhouse background. This shouldn't be disabled if using Content Patcher.
config.toggles.enablecritter-tooltip: Toggle to allow critters like butterflys to enter through open windows
config.toggles.enabledrift-tooltip: Toggle to allow particles to drift through the windows
config.toggles.enablelightshaft-tooltip: Toggle to show the light shaft during a sunny day
config.toggles.enablelightfill-tooltip: Toggle to disable the square fill light behind the windows for sunny day effect if it isn't being rendered correctly.
config.toggles.disablevanillalight-toolt: Toggle to show or remove the Vanilla backing light
config.toggles.enablethunder-tooltip: Toggle to play the thunder SFX when lightning strikes
config.toggles.enablelightning-tooltip: Toggle if the effect is on or not
config.general.driftchance-tooltip: Set % chance particles can drift inside if in the lower window
config.general.critterchance-tooltip: Set % chance Critters can spawn inside, 1 = 100%
config.section.rain-tooltip: Settings for the indoor rain visual effect.
config.rain.density-tooltip: How many raindrops appear on the window. More is heavier. *Note: Higher density may have an impact on performance.
config.rain.speed-tooltip: How fast the rain falls. Higher means faster.
config.rain.size-tooltip: The scale/size of the individual raindrop streaks.
config.rain.alpha-tooltip: The transparency of the raindrops. 1.0 is fully visible.
config.rain.speedX-tooltip: Adds randomness to raindrop speeds to create a depth effect. 0 is uniform speed.
config.section.snow-tooltip: Settings for the indoor snow visual effect.
config.snow.density-tooltip: Controls how many snowflakes appear on the window. *Note: Higher density may have an impact on performance.
config.snow.size-tooltip: The scale/size of the individual snowflake particles.
config.snow.speedX-tooltip: Adds randomness to snowflake speeds to create a depth effect. 0 is uniform speed.
config.section.sunny-tooltip: Controls the dust motes that appear in sunbeams on sunny days.
config.sunny.density-tooltip: How many dust motes appear in each window. *Note: Higher density may have an impact on performance.
config.sunny.size-tooltip: The base size of each dust mote.
config.sunny.alpha-tooltip: The base transparency of the dust motes.
config.section.leaf-tooltip: Settings for the leaves that blow across the windows on windy days.
config.leaf.density-tooltip: How many leaves appear on screen at once. *Note: Higher density may have an impact on performance.
config.leaf.size-tooltip: The general size of the leaf sprites.
config.leaf.alpha-tooltip: The transparency of the leaves. 1.0 is fully visible.
config.leaf.speed-tooltip: Adjust the overall speed of the leaves. Higher is faster
config.section.snow.foreground-tooltip: Controls for the fastest, most opaque snowflakes that appear closest to you.
config.section.snow.midground-tooltip: Controls for the standard snowflakes that make up the bulk of the effect.
config.section.snow.background-tooltip: Controls for the slowest, most transparent snowflakes that appear farthest away.
config.debugging.enablelog-tooltip: If true, verbose debug messages will appear in the SMAPI console. Only enable for troubleshooting.
config.debugging.logtype-tooltip: If Debug is on, choose the type of logging. Normal: Highest priority slow Logging. Flood: High frequency logging for complete debugging and logic chain.
